fields.value: Symmetries of a reduced fluid-gyrokinetic system

authorName.value: R. L. White, R. D. Hazeltine, N. F. Loureiro

dsDescriptionValue.value: Symmetries of a  fluid-gyrokinetic model are investigated using Lie group techniques. Specifically the nonlinear system constructed by Zocco and Schekochihin (Zocco & Schekochihin 2011), which combines nonlinear  fluid equations with a drift-kinetic description of parallel electron dynamics, is studied. Significantly, this model is fully gyrokinetic, allowing for arbitrary $k_{\bot \rho I}$ where $k_\bot$  is the perpendicular wave vector of the  fluctuations and $\rho I}$ is the ion gyroradius. The model includes integral operators corresponding to gyroaveraging as well as the moment equations relating fluid variables to the kinetic distribution function. A large variety of exact symmetries is uncovered, some of which have unexpected form. Using these results, new nonlinear solutions are constructed, including a helical generalization of the Chapman-Kendall solution for a collapsing current sheet.
